contest-event.event-date: July 21, 1900 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Gems from Sullivan's Operas No. 1 Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK Best Cornet: Areal Griffin Best Soprano: Wingates Best Tenor Horn: Black Dyke Best Trombone: Denton Original Best Euphonium: Wingates Feb. 9, 2010, 12:45 p.m. Aug. 28, 2013, 1:42 p.m. 1 Denton Original Alexander Owen 2 Black Dyke Band John Gladney Jnr 3 Wingates Band William Rimmer 4 Lee Mount William Swingler 5 Abertillery Silver Henry Bentley Unknown Result Aberdare Town Jesse Manley Unknown Result Batley Old Alexander Owen Unknown Result Besses o' th' Barn Alexander Owen Unknown Result Wyke Edwin Swift Unknown Result Hucknall Gospel Temperance John Gladney Jnr Unknown Result Rushden Windmill Band Alexander Owen Unknown Result Ferndale Samuel Radcliffe Unknown Result Kettering Rifles Alexander Owen Unknown Result West Hartlepool Old Alexander Owen
